GiverText: Welcome my child, I... am Jesus, and I need your help. In the woods to the West there is a Fox who is spreading blasphemy, I need him silenced.
Response2: I will kill the Fox for you in the name of Christ!

GiverText: It all started 6,000 years ago when he ate the forbidden fruit. He convinced man and women to join him and create the first original sin.
Response2: I understand, he will be dealt with.

GiverText:
*It appears he goes on a rant about how foxes corrupted mankind and how foxes are the cause of thievery, murder, and adultery*

My brother, will you help me restore peace to mankind by killing the beast?
Response2: I don't really buy that story, but I hear that fox meat is delicious. I'll do it.
Response3: I think you need to see a psychiatrist.

GiverText: NO! IT WAS THE FOX! He has been spreading vile lies that snake brought upon original sin, and I can see that the lies have penetrated the depths of society. I beg you, remove this heathen from the earth!
EndText: I can feel his power waning.
Response1: Fine, I'll kill the damn thing.
Response3: The only liar I see is the one standing in front of me. Find someone else to fight your holy war.

GiverText: Report back to me when the Fox is dead
ObjectiveText: Kill the Fox because you are hungry and because it will make Jesus happy
Response1: It will be done my Lord.

GiverText: He is surrounded by his followers my child, they have many blades and are surrounded by a ring of fire. Do not underestimate him my child, for he is more far more cunning than he lets on.
EndText: It is finished, here is your reward my Stalwart Knight.
Response3: A ring of fire? I don't like the sound of that. Uh I think I may be out.

GiverText: Yes, yes, it will burn, burn, BURN! The ring of fire.... the ring of fire.
EndText: The Ring of Fire has been cleansed, thank you soldier. We'll need you for the war to come.
Response2: Cool, well I'll be back, after I kill this Fox I guess.
Response1: Well, in that case, I'd prefer not fight this Fox.

GiverText: Yes, a ring of fire, into which you must go down, down, down, until the flame gets higher.
ObjectiveText: Muse on the philosophies of fire.
Response2: Cool, so again is it like too late to go back on me promising to kill this Fox for you or something or...

EndText: Here is your reward, for which you so lusted after, enjoy it as I am enjoing the Fox's perishment.
Response2: Whatever, I'll kill this Fox for you, but I better be getting something out of this.

GiverText: Oh it's far too late for that. For now you owe me a blood oath, one which shall not be broken lightly. Only the blood of the Fox can break our bond now.
EndText: I can sense the Fox's demise. This is for you.
Response2: What, I'll just kill the damned thing, I'm not gonna bring it's blood back to you.
Response1: Alright well, I don't know why agreed to this, the warning signs were there from the beginning with you.
Response3: Cool, by the way I may kill you when I get back.
